sentences.english: The USSR was so proud of the synchrophasotron.
sentences.chinese: 苏联是如此为这个加速器而自豪。

sentences.english: Some of the women-teachers are usually proud of their position of being a Diana.
sentences.chinese: 有些女教师常常以保持独身主义地位而自豪。

sentences.english: She is proud of her horsemanship.
sentences.chinese: 她为自己的骑术感到自豪。

sentences.english: The Eagles prided themselves on being clean living, not using cuss words and treating each other with respect.
sentences.chinese: 老鹰队自豪于自己的生活严谨，不说脏话，尊重他人。

sentences.english: I pride myself on always thinking outside the box.
sentences.chinese: 我以自己常具创意革新的思维而感到自豪。

sentences.english: This is the most precious treasure of which Dragon & Lion takes the utmost pride.
sentences.chinese: 这是龙狮最为自豪和值得骄傲的宝贵财富。

sentences.english: We are very proud of our partnership with Huaxin.
sentences.chinese: 与华新的合作伙伴关系使我们深感自豪。

sentences.english: Because of pride and wanting to help the team and play in the Clasico.
sentences.chinese: 因为我觉得能为球队效力是一件很自豪的事情。

sentences.english: Their father gloried in their success.
sentences.chinese: 他们的父亲为他们的成功而自豪。

sentences.english: Even president Jacques Chirac, said the team had made the country proud.
sentences.chinese: 尽管希拉克总统，说球队令全国为以自豪。

sentences.english: "I feel so sad - but proud, too, " she says.
sentences.chinese: “我很伤心但同时也很自豪，”她说。

sentences.english: I had no grandparent to stand proudly for me.
sentences.chinese: 没有祖父母会为我自豪地站起来。

sentences.english: While he was proud he was also a modest man.
sentences.chinese: 他感到自豪，但他也是一个谦逊的人。

sentences.english: And I was rather proud of this method. And I published it with great delight.
sentences.chinese: 我对自己的方法很自豪，就非常高兴地把论文发表了。

sentences.english: I have more time to think these days, Jeff…I'm proud of you.
sentences.chinese: 这阵子我有更多的时间想些事情，杰夫，我为你自豪。

sentences.english: I know he's excited for Adam. Proud even.
sentences.chinese: 其实我知道他为亚当而兴奋，甚至自豪。

definition: to regard it as an honor (idiom)
happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
to stir oneself up/to raise one's spirits/to inspire
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
